comment: What would you have done? Shoot or not? Why? Article: Updaten Friday Dunn was indicted on a charge of nd degree murder and taken into custody. (42/42)
amr:
# ::snt What would you have done? Shoot or not? Why? Article: Updaten Friday Dunn was indicted on a charge of nd degree murder and taken into custody. (42/42)
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (d / do-02
            :ARG0 (y / you)
            :ARG1 (a / amr-unknown))
      :snt2 (o / or
            :op1 (s / shoot-02)
            :op2 (s2 / shoot-02
                  :polarity -)
            :polarity (a2 / amr-unknown))
      :snt3 (c / cause-01
            :ARG0 (a3 / amr-unknown))
      :snt4 (a4 / article
            :ARG1-of (m2 / mean-01
                  :ARG2 (a5 / and
                        :op1 (ii / indict-01
                              :ARG1 (p / person
                                    :name (n / name
                                          :op1 "Dunn")
                                    :name (n2 / name
                                          :op1 "Updaten"))
                              :ARG2 (c2 / charge-05
                                    :ARG1 p
                                    :ARG2 (m3 / murder-01
                                          :mod (d2 / degree
                                                :mod (v / variable
                                                      :name (n3 / name
                                                            :op1 "nd"))))))
                        :op2 (t / take-01
                              :ARG1 p
                              :ARG3 (c3 / custody)))))
      :snt5 (s3 / slash
            :op1 42
            :op2 42))

comment: There are two particular slurs here, one anti-Muslim and one anti-transgender. One individual does not represent a group on the whole.
amr:
# ::snt There are two particular slurs here, one anti-Muslim and one anti-transgender. One individual does not represent a group on the whole.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (s / slur
            :quant 2
            :mod (p / particular)
            :location (h / here)
            :ARG1-of (m2 / mean-01
                  :ARG2 (a / and
                        :op1 (o / oppose-01
                              :ARG0 (o2 / one)
                              :ARG1 (r / religious-group
                                    :name (n / name
                                          :op1 "Muslim")))
                        :op2 (o3 / oppose-01
                              :ARG0 o2
                              :ARG1 (t / transgender)))))
      :snt2 (r2 / represent-01
            :polarity -
            :ARG0 (ii / individual
                  :quant 1)
            :ARG1 (g / group
                  :mod (w / whole))))
